verses.roman:
hena-kāle jagannāthera pāṇi-śaṅkha bājilā
snāna kari' mahāprabhu daraśane gelā

synonyms: hena-kāle—at this time; jagannāthera—of Lord Jagannātha; pāṇi-śaṅkha—a conchshell that can be held in the hand; bājilā—vibrated; snāna kari'-after bathing; mahāprabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; daraśane gelā—went to see Lord Jagannātha.
translation: Just then, everyone heard the blowing of the conchshell at the Jagannātha temple. Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu immediately took His bath and went to see Lord Jagannātha.
